results.title: Don't be cut up
results.creator_credit: Joan Hansen, R.D. Hansen, Fortune Film Productions and New South Wales. Dept. of Labour and Industry
results.brief_description:
This 1959 film outlines the hazards associated with the metal trade industry. It emphasises the importance of fixed guards on machines including guillotines, bending brakes, power presses and emery wheels. The film is interspersed with title cards including the repeated ‘Accidents need not happen’ and features a voiceover narration dramatically warning against accidents. It is directed at both workers in the factory risking accident and disability, and employers risking loss of production and financial loss.

Produced by Fortune Film Productions and the New South Wales Department of Labour and Industry.

Please note: As this is an archival work, the content does not reflect current practice or standards. Professional advice for up-to-date safety practices should be sought from the appropriate contemporary authority.

results.title: Don't be a fall guy
results.creator_credit: Ron Collins, Stan Murdoch, Reg Perier and New South Wales. Dept. of Labour and Industry
results.brief_description:
This 1962 instructional film demonstrates safety regulations on building sites in Sydney, New South Wales. Narrated by a didactic voiceover, the film dramatises the do’s and dont’s of construction sites, including good housekeeping, adequate lighting, head protection, guard rails, proper scaffolding and safety lines. It emphasises the risks of carelessness and overconfidence of builders working without proper safety equipment.

In order to demonstrate this, the film restages several accidents, including a man falling down an open lift shaft after the guard rail was removed by a fellow builder. The film also includes footage of riggers climbing steel frames on multi-story buildings without safety harnesses, in what would have been standard practice in this era.

Produced by the New South Wales Department of Labour and Industry.

Please note: As this is an archival work, the content does not reflect current practice or standards. Professional advice for up-to-date safety practices should be sought from the appropriate contemporary authority.

results.title: The Destruction of St. Patrick's College 1971
results.brief_description: The old St Patrick’s College was demolished to make way for an ecclesiastic office building. Professor Hartley Gratten, of the University of Texas considers, against the background of the demolition by Whelan the Wrecker, why Australians ignore their national heritage.

results.title: The Daydreamer
results.brief_description: An example of independent Melbourne film production. A young man watching a girl pass by his window, imagines himself the hero in a series of fantastic situations in which the maiden’s honour is threatened by diverse evil characters. Made by Michael Martin, assisted by Garry Martin, Bruce McNaughton and Doug Hobbs.

results.title: Coma
results.creator_credit: Ray Argall, St John Ambulance Australia and British Petroleum
results.brief_description:
Coma can be caused by epilspsy, drowning, drug overdose or head injuries. Shows what to do for people in a deep coma. The victim should be moved into the approved coma position until medical help arrives. It is the only treatment that a first aider can and should apply.

PLEASE NOTE: As this is an archival work, the content does not reflect current practice or standards. Professional advice for up-to-date first-aid practices should be sought from the appropriate contemporary authority.

results.title: The Cave: a parable told by Orson Welles
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, C B Wismar, Nick Bosustow and Counterpoint Films
results.brief_description: An animated dramatization based on “The Allegory of the Cave” from Book 7 of Plato’s “Republic” illustrating mankind’s escape from the world of illusion to the world of reality. Four men chained in a cave take images reflected on a wall for the truth. Narrated by Orson Welles.

results.title: Caulfield: a Living City
results.creator_credit: John Freney-Mills, Ewart Wade, Caulfield City Council and Caulfield Film Society
results.brief_description:
Weekend activities in the City of Caulfield. Schools, churches, sporting and social service groups keep the city alive at weekends. Activities include the running of the Caulfield Cup, and quieter games such as tennis and bowls. School children learn road safety at special classes and attend the Youth Centre. For the elderly citizens there are “meals-on-wheels”.

results.title: The Car Stealers
results.creator_credit: Eric L. Morris, Geoffrey Thompson, Council of Fire and Accident Underwriters and Cine Services
results.brief_description: Dramatizes the problem of car theft and joy-riding by young teenagers in Australia. Points out to car owners and parents how their carelessness can be partly responsible. Shows safety devices and security checks for car-owners. Made with the co-operation of the Victorian Police.

results.title: A Bridge in music
results.creator_credit: Muir Mathieson, Alexander Shaw and Unesco
results.brief_description: Yehudi Menuhin and Eastern musician Ayana Deva Angadi compare Eastern and Western music and discuss how we can come to understand and appreciate that which is foreign to us in terms of that which is familiar. Characteristic techniques are shown, and the film includes examples of music from India, Japan, Cambodia, Italy, Germany and France.
results.description: Yehudi Menuhin and Eastern musician Ayana Deva Angadi compare Eastern and Western music and discuss how we can come to understand and appreciate that which is foreign to us in terms of that which is familiar. results.title: Born in the sun
results.creator_credit: John Heyer and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Shows the development of the dried fruits industry at Mildura from the time of Deakin’s irrigation bill, and highlights the part irrigation has played. Includes a dramatised extract of an Alfred Deakin speech. The film shows climatic setbacks which the industry has experienced. Illustrates the harvesting, processing and distribution of the fruit.
